domain_guidance:
When evaluating communication skills, pay special attention to:
- The frequency and consistency of communication attempts
- Whether the child initiates or only responds
- The range of communication functions (requesting, commenting, etc.)
- The use of gestures, vocalizations, or words
- The child's comprehension of language
- Any atypical communication patterns

category_descriptions.cannot_do_desc: Child shows no evidence of the communication skill or makes no attempts
category_descriptions.with_support_desc: Child demonstrates the communication skill with prompting, modeling, or in limited contexts
category_descriptions.emerging_desc: Child is beginning to use the communication skill but is inconsistent or limited
category_descriptions.independent_desc: Child uses the communication skill consistently across contexts without support
category_descriptions.lost_skill_desc: Child previously demonstrated the communication skill but has regressed or lost the ability
